intro: Quararibea alversonii, commonly known as the Alverson's quararibea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are typically surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Quararibea alversonii is a shrub that thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
